Conclusion: We should adapt the viable pay incentive scheme

Conclusion: We should adapt the viable pay incentive scheme
Premise: Variable pay helps in retaining valuable employees. This helps in retaining good talent for long periods of time and thereby, less spending on hiring new talents. This provides stability to the organization.

Conclusion: We should adapt the viable pay incentive scheme
Premise: It has been seen that it is difficult to retain employees in lean times when they are on variable pay schemes. Workers who receive commissions do well when business is good, but they do poorly when business is bad. In times of slow business, even top salespeople might have difficulty making enough sales to earn a decent living. If the market is slow and commissioned workers can’t earn enough, they may look for other employment opportunities. In lean times, fixed wages can be more effective at keeping employees from leaving for other opportunities.

Conclusion: We should sponsor the general population for taking in migrants
Premise: Integrating one non-western immigrant cost ca. Euro 167,000,-. Who will be paying that ?

Conclusion: We should reduce environment pollution by limiting number of people in Europe
Premise: I don't see how stopping putting a stop to migration will suddenly impact our eco footprint in that extend. Firstly, migration is in our nature. Without migration you wouldn't be here.  second, the cost of migration is self-sustained.

Conclusion: We should reduce environment pollution by limiting number of people in Europe
Premise: A migrant, with the proper education and support, will in his turn contribute for society, which allows more people to have a fulfilling life.

Conclusion: We should not allow solar power plants to be used to damage nature.
Premise: I absolutely agree that solar power plants should not be deployed on fertile, arable land & wood should not be cut down to make place for this endeavor. This needs to be regulated swiftly!

Conclusion: We should include all costs of nuclear energy in our comparisons, for example insurance and disposal
Premise: If you want to do it for nuclear power, then it would be better to do it for every single kind of energy production methods. It’s also important then to include the complete cycle of all the energies, the human cost, the extraction of primary resources, in the case of renewable energy, take into account the necessary energy storage, and so on and so forth.

Conclusion: We should promote awareness in society of what migrants are contributing.
Premise: Misconceptions like the view that mass migration is somehow 'good' need to be clearly pointed out.

Conclusion: We should remove illegal immigrants.
Premise: EU must take action. Help those in need, but only those who respect legal boundaries. Mutual respect is a cornerstone in this subject where we must set limits to protect Europe.

Conclusion: We should protect the European border.
Premise: Frontex is the way to protect the European border. It should completely take over every border, land, sea, and air. Otherwise, it will just take over all the good personnel of a member state, causing even more problems at the border.

Conclusion: We should stop daylight saving time change
Premise: All countries should get back to their geographically correct time zone. It is in public often discussed as a matter of preference. But public health cannot be decided by inquiries about people's preferences. Several scientific and health organizations already published statements to speak up for at least permanent standard time and warn about the health implications of permanent or seasonal daylight saving time. And there is plenty more to list. Education suffers from Daylight Saving Time as much as the Economy, mainly because of productivity loss due to chronic sleep deprivation and disturbances and the increase in health costs.

Conclusion: We should strengthen the public role of faith-based communities in environmental protection
Premise: A reflection on the future of Europe needs to identify and involve other actors alongside local and international institutions to fully deploy the founding values of our continent in addressing major global challenges.

Conclusion: We should legalize non-violent drug offenses
Premise: Psychedelic medicines specifically have the potential to radically transform our mental health care.

Conclusion: We should legalize non-violent drug use
Premise: European institutions should take factual studies of the relative harm of different drugs into account. A UK study has shown that drugs such as cannabis and many hallucinogenic drugs are far less harmful than alcohol. The study in question was conducted by David J Nutt, Leslie A King, Lawrence D Phillips, on behalf of the Independent Scientific Committee on Drugs

The organization of migration is a crime against humanity. Gangsters like Lukashenka and Soros should be held accountable!

Conclusion: We should stop integration.
Premise: This is genuinely the most humane proposal. If Europeans are 'privileged' we should use that to help foreign nations. Premise: Frontex deserves much more political support, especially from the European Commission. It is already playing an important role to manage the border and is called to play a crucial one in the coming years.

Conclusion: We should stop immigration.
Premise: The official UN definition of the word 'genocide' includes imposing measures intended to prevent births within the group and forcibly transferring children of the group to another group. This is what the EU is doing to its own member states by allowing immigration into Europe from the Middle East and Africa.  Therefore, I can only conclude that EU bureaucrats hate native Europeans.

Premise: Illegal loopholes in the legislation are enabling illegal migration. Family Reunification has been and remains the biggest channel of migration into the EU.

Conclusion: We should remove unauthorized asylum seekers or migrants.
Premise: Many countries have the view that unauthorized asylum seekers should be removed.

Conclusion: We should restrict immigration.
Premise: Foreigners and immigrants must not be provided the same services and advantages as native people.

Conclusion: We should stop buying Russian gas
Premise: The cost of gas will be higher. But I prefer to pay a little more for the gas bill than to finance Putin’s malicious activities.

Conclusion: We should strengthen our ties with Ukraine and prepare for its membership in the EU
Premise: We must support countries that want to improve the welfare and rights of their citizens. If a country wants to join the EU and meets the conditions for joining, the decision to join is solely between the candidate country and the EU.

Conclusion: We should give up developing electric vehicles
Premise: Market orientation is difficult. In the absence of subsidies, no license restrictions and other policies, whether the sales of pure electric vehicles can still grow steadily is questionable.

Conclusion: We should restrict minors from playing online games.
Premise: Rather than restricting minors to play games, parents should set a good example and spend more time with their children.

Conclusion: We should ease the education involution.
Premise: A society's value of education should not remain "score-only" and "testing-only".

Conclusion: We should vigorously develop the countryside.
Premise: In this field of food we can not be subject to others, even if imported food is cheaper, we can not rely on imports, but to vigorously develop our own level of agriculturalization.
